awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Moser-Trudinger Inequality and       Applications
awd_abstract_narration: Chang  9401465       This award continues support for mathematical research on  problems involving sharp forms of the classical Sobolev embedding  theorem.  The result is stated in terms of fundamental  comparisons called inequalities of Moser-Trudinger type.  These  inequalities have been shown to be valuable in a number of  problems involving nonlinear partial differential equations,  spectral analysis and conformal geometry.  Work will be done on  the ratio of determinant of the Laplacian operator of two  conformally related metrics, on the extremal metric of  zeta functional determinants on four-manifolds and on the  geometric meaning of the constants in the sharp form of the   Moser-Trudinger inequalities.       The study of Sobolev embedding is part of a broad program  in geometric analysis aimed at understanding various  curvature metrics which can exist on surfaces (manifolds) and how  the surfaces can be constructed from a given description of  their curvature.  The inequalities arise in the study of the  Laplace operator on the surfaces and the resulting constants  which occur in the relationship between integrals of solutions  and integrals of their gradients.  ***
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
